item.title: "It was the system. We can't change it."
item.description: From the final novella of David Mitchell’s The Bone Clocks, set in Ireland in 2043: ‘Number one is to survive’, answers Hood, watching the men on the roof. ‘They’re all dead, like my parents. They had a better life than I did, mind. So did you. Your power stations, your cars, your creature comforts. Well, you lived too long. The bill’s due. Today,’ up on the roof the bold is cut on the first panel, ‘you start to pay.
